speaker: Programmer
text: Hi Apiza

speaker: Apiza
text: Hello!

speaker: Apiza
text: I am Apiza, a virtual assistant designed to help you navigate and use APIs.

speaker: Apiza
text: How can I help?

speaker: Programmer
text: What is the definition of structure of ALLERGO_EVENT

speaker: Apiza
text: I found the following description for ALLEGRO_EVENT:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: An ALLEGRO_EVENT is a union of all builtin event structures, i.e. it is an object large enough to hold the data of any event type.

speaker: Apiza
text:
All events have the following fields in common:

type (ALLEGRO_EVENT_TYPE)
	Indicates the type of event.
any.source (ALLEGRO_EVENT_SOURCE *)
	The event source which generated the event.
any.timestamp (double)
	When the event was generated.

speaker: Programmer
text: What are the possible values for ALLERGO_EVENT_TYPE

speaker: Programmer
text: And ALLERGO_EVENT_SOURCE

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLERGO_EVENT_TYPE is an enum with several values, including ALLEGRO_EVENT_JOYSTICK_AXIS , ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_DOWN , and ALLEGRO_EVENT_MOUSE_AXES. There are 30 different values in total.

speaker: Apiza
text: Are you looking for one type in particular?

speaker: Apiza
text: I found the following description of ALLEGRO_EVENT_SOURCE:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: An event source is any object which can generate events. For example, an ALLEGRO_DISPLAY can generate events, and you can get the ALLEGRO_EVENT_SOURCE pointer from an ALLEGRO_DISPLAY with al_get_display_event_source.\n\nYou may create your own "user" event sources that emit custom events.

speaker: Programmer
text: Please tell me more about ALlERGO_EVENT_KEY events

speaker: Apiza
text: There are three different types of EVENT_KEY events: ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_DOWN, ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_UP, and ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_CHAR

speaker: Programmer
text: Is there allergo_event key left and key right

speaker: Apiza
text: I found two Key codes: ALLEGRO_KEY_LEFT and ALLEGRO_KEY_RIGHT.

speaker: Apiza
text: These can be used with keyboard routines such as al_key_down

speaker: Programmer
text: Tell me more about al_key routines

speaker: Apiza
text:
There are 9 functions directly relating to the keyboard:

al_install_keyboard
al_is_keyboard_installed
al_uninstall_keyboard
al_get_keyboard_state
al_clear_keyboard_state
al_key_down
al_keycode_to_name
al_set_keyboard_leds
al_get_keyboard_event_source

speaker: Programmer
text: What function plays an audio file?

speaker: Apiza
text: There are many function related to Audio playback.

speaker: Apiza
text: al_play_sample plays a given ALLEGRO_SAMPLE.\n

speaker: Apiza
text: bool al_play_sample(ALLEGRO_SAMPLE *spl, float gain, float pan, float speed,\n ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE loop, ALLEGRO_SAMPLE_ID *ret_id)

speaker: Apiza
text: Would you like help loading and playing an ALLEGRO_SAMPLE?

speaker: Programmer
text: Yes

speaker: Apiza
text: Sure thing!

speaker: Apiza
text: It looks like this is how you could load and play an audio file:

speaker: Apiza
Programmer
text: Why is allergo sample* mistaken as int*

speaker: Programmer
text: What does the function al_load_sample return

speaker: Apiza
text: The al_load_sample function looks like this:

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLEGRO_SAMPLE *al_load_sample(const char *filename)\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns the sample on success, NULL on failure.

speaker: Apiza
text: For sample-loading errors, it look like you may need to initialize the "audio codec add-on". Use `al_init_acodec_addon()` to initialize the audio codec.

speaker: Programmer
text: Can you help me with fuctions that draw bitmap

speaker: Apiza
text: I'm happy to help!

speaker: Apiza
text: Where would you like to start with bitmap drawing?

speaker: Programmer
text: I want to draw a png

speaker: Apiza
text: Alright, the variable that you will need to initialize is an ALLEGRO_BITMAP. You can do so with the function al_create_bitmap:

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLEGRO_BITMAP *al_create_bitmap(int w, int h)

speaker: Programmer
text: What function takes a png file as input and draws a bitmap?

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLEGRO_BITMAP *al_load_bitmap(const char *filename)\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Loads an image file into a new ALLEGRO_BITMAP.

speaker: Apiza
text: The file type is determined by the extension, except if the file has no extension in which case al_identify_bitmap is used instead.\n\nReturns NULL on error.

speaker: Programmer
text: Load bitmap returns null

speaker: Apiza
text: If you\'re getting errors loading an image, you may need to initialize the "image addon."

speaker: Apiza
text: You can do this using al_init_image_addon()

text: Image not displayed event after loading the png in bitmap?
